00047 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00048 
00049 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00050 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00051 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00052 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00053 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00054 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00055 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00056 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00057 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00058 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00060 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00061 
00062 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00063 
00064 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00065 
00066 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00067 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00068 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00069 
00070 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00071 
00072     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00073 }
00074 
00075 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00076 
00077 {
00078     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00079     spl_t flags;
00080 
00081     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00082 
00083     adeos_load_cpuid();
00084 
00085     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00086         {
00087         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00088             /* Use a non-locking test in the inner loop, as Linux'es
00089                bit_spin_lock. */
00090             while (test_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1, lock))
00091                 cpu_relax();
00092         }
00093     else
00094         flags |= 2;
00095 
00096     return flags;
00097 }
00098 
00099 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00100 
00101 {
00102     if (!(flags & 2))
00103         {
00104         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00105 
00106         rthal_cli();
00107 
00108         adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111             {
00112             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00113             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00114             cpu_relax(); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00115             }
00116         }
00117 
00118     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00119 }
00120 
00121 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00122 
00123 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00124 
00125 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00126 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00127 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00128 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00129 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00130 
00131 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00184 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00185 
00186     /* Kernel mode side */
00187 
00188 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00189     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00190        and SPE are not available to kernel-based nucleus threads. */
00191     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00192     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00193 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00194 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00195 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00196 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00197 
00198     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00199     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00200     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00201     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00202 
00203     /* User mode side */
00204     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00205     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00206 
00207     /* Init block */
00208     struct xnthread *self;
00209     int imask;
00210     const char *name;
00211     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00212     void *cookie;
00213 
00214 } xnarchtcb_t;

00242 static inline long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (long long ts) {
00243     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00244 }
00245 
00246 static inline long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (long long ns) {
00247     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00248 }
00249 
00250 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00251     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00252 }
00253 
00254 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00255     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00256 }

00258 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00259     return adeos_processor_id();
00260 }

00262 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00263 
00264 {
00265 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00266     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00267         return vmalloc(bytes);
00268 #endif
00269 
00270     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00271 }
00272 
00273 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00274 
00275 {
00276 #if 0   /* FIXME: likely on-demand mapping bug here */
00277     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00278         vfree(chunk);
00279     else
00280 #endif
00281         kfree(chunk);
00282 }

00289 do { \
00290     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \

00292     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \

00299 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00300 
00301 {
00302     spl_t s;
00303     splhigh(s);
00304     splexit(!!imask);
00305     return !!s;
00306 }

00361 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00362 
00363 {
00364 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00365     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00366 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00367     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00368        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00369     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00370 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00371 }

00373 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00374                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00375     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00376 }
00377 
00378 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00379 
00380 {
00381     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00382 
00383     adeos_load_cpuid();
00384 
00385     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00386        and always inside a critical section. */
00387     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00388     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00389     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00390     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00391 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00392     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00393 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00394 }
00395 
00396 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00397     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00398 }
00399 
00400 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00401                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00402 {
00403     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00404     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00405     unsigned long flags;
00406 
00407     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00408 
00409     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00410 
00411     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00412         {
00413         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00414         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00415 
00416         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00417 
00418         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00419 
00420         if (prev != next)
00421             {
00422             get_mmu_context(next);
00423             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00424             }
00425 
00426         if (!inproc->mm)
00427             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00428 
00429         /* The following has been lifted from
00430            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00431 
00432 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00433         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00434             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00435 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00436         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00437             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00438 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00439 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00440         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00441             giveup_spe(outproc);
00442 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00443 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00444 
00445 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00446         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00447             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00448 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00449 
00450 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00451         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00452             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00453 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00454 
00455         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00456         }
00457     else
00458         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00459         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00460 
00461     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00462 }
00463 
00464 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00465                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00466     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00467 }
00468 
00469 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00470     /* Empty */
00471 }
00472 
00473 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00474                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00475                                          const char *name)
00476 {
00477     tcb->user_task = current;
00478     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00479     tcb->ksp = 0;
00480     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00481 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00482     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00483 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00484     tcb->entry = NULL;
00485     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00486     tcb->self = thread;
00487     tcb->imask = 0;
00488     tcb->name = name;
00489 }
00490 
00491 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00492 
00493     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00494     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00495     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00496 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00497     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00498 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00499     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00500 }
00501 
00502 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00503 
00504 {
00505     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00506     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00507     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00508     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00509 }
00510 
00511 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00512                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00513                                        void *cookie,
00514                                        int imask,
00515                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00516                                        char *name)
00517 {
00518     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00519 
00520     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00521 
00522     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00523     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00524     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00525     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00526     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00527     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00528 
00529     tcb->entry = entry;
00530     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00531     tcb->self = thread;
00532     tcb->imask = imask;
00533     tcb->name = name;
00534 }
00535 
00536 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00537 
00538 {
00539 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00540     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00541        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00542     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00543     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00544 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00545 }
00546 
00547 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00548 
00549 {
00550 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00551 
00552     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00553 
00554     if (task)
00555         {
00556         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00557             giveup_fpu(task);
00558 
00559         return;
00560         }
00561 
00562     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00563 
00564     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00565 
00566 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00567 }
00568 
00569 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00570 
00571 {
00572 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00573 
00574     if (tcb->user_task)
00575         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00576            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00577            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00578         return;
00579 
00580     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00581 
00582     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00583 
00584 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00585 }
00586 
00587 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00588 
00589 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00590 
00591     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00592 }
00593 
00594 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00595 
00596 {
00597     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00598                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00599                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00600                                      NULL,
00601                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00602 }
00603 
00604 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00605 
00606 {
00607     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00608                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00609                                      NULL,
00610                                      NULL,
00611                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00612 }
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00615 
00616 {
00617     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00618     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00619 }
00620 
00621 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00622 
00623 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t cpumask) {
00624 
00625     return 0;
00626 }
00627 
00628 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00629 
00630     return 0;
00631 }
00632 
00633 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00634 
00635     return 0;
00636 }
00637 
00638 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00639 
00640 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00641 
00642 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00643 
00644 {
00645 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00646     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00647        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00648     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00649 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00650 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00651     xnshadow_release_events();
00652 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00653     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00654     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00655     schedule_timeout(50);
00656     xnarch_release_ipi();
00657 }
00658 
00659 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00660 
00661 {
00662     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00663 
00664     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00665         {
00666         spl_t s;
00667         splsync(s);
00668         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00669         splexit(s);
00670         return 1;
00671         }
00672 
00673     return 0;
00674 }
00675 
00676 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00677 
00678 {
00679 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00680     xnshadow_grab_events();
00681 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00682 }
00683 
00684 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00685 
00686 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00687 
00688 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00689                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00690                                            const char *name)
00691 {
00692     struct task_struct *task = current;
00693 
00694     tcb->user_task = task;
00695     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00696     tcb->ksp = 0;
00697     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00698 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00699     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00700 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00701     tcb->entry = NULL;
00702     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00703     tcb->self = thread;
00704     tcb->imask = 0;
00705     tcb->name = name;
00706 }
00707 
00708 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00709 
00710 {
00711     unsigned irq;
00712 
00713     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00714         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00715                              handler,
00716                              NULL,
00717                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00718 
00719     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00720        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00721        individually. */
00722 
00723     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00724                          handler,
00725                          NULL,
00726                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00727 }
00728 
00729 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00730 
00731 {
00732     unsigned irq;
00733 
00734     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00735         {
00736         switch (irq)
00737             {
00738 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00739             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00740 
00741                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00742                 continue;
00743 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00744 
00745             default:
00746 
00747                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00748             }
00749         }
00750 
00751     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00752 }
00753 
00754 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00755 
00756 {
00757     unsigned irq;
00758 
00759     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00760         {
00761         switch (irq)
00762             {
00763 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00764             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00765 
00766                 continue;
00767 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00768 
00769             default:
00770 
00771                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00772             }
00773         }
00774 
00775     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00776 }
00777 
00778 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00779 
00780 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00781 
00782 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay) {
00783     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00784        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough for
00785        now. If a timer need more, a spurious but harmless call to the tick
00786        handler will occur after 4 billions ticks. Since the timebase value is
00787        used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC port, there is no need to
00788        rescale the delay value. */
00789     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00790 }
00791 
00792 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00793     rthal_release_timer();
00794 }
00795 
00796 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00797 
00798 {
00799 #if CONFIG_SMP
00800     return -1;          /* FIXME */
00801 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00802     return 0;
00803 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00804 }
00805 
00806 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00807                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00808                                         unsigned long long defval)
00809 {
00810 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00811     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00812     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00813     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00814 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00815     *shot = defval;
00816     *delivery = defval;
00817 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00818 }
00819 
00820 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00827

00829     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);

00832     hcb->shmbase = NULL;

00835 static inline int xnarch_remap_page_range(struct vm_area_struct *vma,
00836                                           unsigned long uvaddr,
00837                                           unsigned long paddr,
00838                                           unsigned long size,
00839                                           pgprot_t prot)
00840 {
00841     return remap_pfn_range(vma,uvaddr,paddr >> PAGE_SHIFT,size,prot);
00842 }

00844 #endif /* XENO_HEAP_MODULE */
00845 
00846 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00847 
00848 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00849 
00850 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00851 
00852 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00853 
00854 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00855 
00856 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00857 
00858 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00859 
00860 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00861 
00862 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00863 
00864 {
00865     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00866     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00867     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00868 }
00869 
00870 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00871 
00872 {
00873 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00874     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00875 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00876     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00877        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00878        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00879        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00880        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00881        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00882     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00883 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00884 }
00885 
00886 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00887 
00888 {
00889     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00890 
00891     if (!nktimerlat)
00892         return -ENODEV;
00893 
00894     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00895 
00896     return 0;
00897 }
00898 
00899 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00900 
00901 {
00902     int err;
00903 
00904 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00905     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00906        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00907     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00908 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00909 
00910     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00911 
00912     if (err)
00913         return err;
00914 
00915     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00916 
00917     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00918         return -ENOSYS;
00919 
00920     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00921                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00922                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00923                               NULL,
00924                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00925 
00926     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00927 
00928 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00929     err = xnshadow_mount();
00930 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00931 
00932     if (err)
00933         {
00934         rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00935         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00936         }
00937 
00938     return err;
00939 }
00940 
00941 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00942 
00943 {
00944 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00945     xnshadow_cleanup();
00946 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00947     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00948     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00949 }
00950 
00951 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00952 
00953 #ifdef __cplusplus
00954 }
00955 #endif

00963 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
